text: Dichrorampha rilana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in AlbaniaFauna Europaea and Bulgaria, where it has been recorded from the Vitosha, Rila and Pirin mountains. The habitat consists of subalpine herbaceous formations on siliceous soils. The length of the forewings is 6.1–6.5 mm for females. The larvae feed on Achillea clusiana.Zlatkov, B. (2013): Remarks on Tortricidae species with unknown and little known females. — Nota lepidopterologica 36 (2): 191–197 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1909 Category:Grapholitini
title: Dichrorampha rilana
